sentences.en: Believe nothing that he can say to my disfavour.
Coal fell into disfavour because burning it caused pollution.
sentences.cn: 煤不再受到欢迎，因为烧煤会造成污染。

sentences.en: He is regarded with disfavour [ unfavourab 1 y ] .
John seems to have fallen into disfavour with Mary.
sentences.cn: 约翰似乎已经失去玛丽的欢心.

sentences.en: Louise won the disfavour of the two Hardy girls Mary and Harriet.
sentences.cn: 路易丝引起哈代家的姑娘玛丽与哈丽特的不满.

sentences.en: Mary seems to look upon John with disfavour.
She eyed his unruly collar-length hair with disfavour.
sentences.cn: 她反感地盯着他那长及衣领的一头乱发。

sentences.en: Soon the queen fell into disfavour and was executed.
sentences.cn: 皇后不久失宠.被处死了.

sentences.en: The minister incurred the king's disfavour.
sentences.cn: 这位大臣招致国王的冷遇.

trans.tran_cn: 不喜爱，厌恶，不赞成，受冷遇
trans.tran_en: a feeling of dislike and disapproval
